sen.j: 主鈴(しゅれい)は律令制において中務省に属した品官。
sen.e: Shurei was officials of Honknan that belonged to Nakatsukasasho under the ritsuryo legal code system.
Shurei was officials of Honknan that belonged to Nakatsukasasho under the ritsuryo legal code system.
Shurei was officials of Honknan that belonged to Nakatsukasasho under the ritsuryo legal code system.

sen.j: 主鈴は中務省直属の官で駅鈴や印鑑の出納・給付を行った。
sen.e: Shurei was the officials under the direct command of Nakatsukasasho and was in charge of delivering and providing Ekirei bells and Seals.
Shurei was the officials under the direct command of Nakatsukasasho and was in charge of delivering and providing Ekirei bells and Seals.
Shurei was the officials under the direct command of Nakatsukasasho and was in charge of delivering and providing Ekirei bells and Seals.

sen.j: 少納言の実質的監督下に置かれ、儀式等において大変重要視された。
sen.e: They were virtually put under the command of Shonagon and regarded as important when there were ceremonies and events.
They were virtually put under the command of Shonagon and regarded as important in ceremonies and events.
sen.cmt: when there were ceremonies and events --> in ceremonies and events
sen.e: They were virtually put under the command of Shonagon and regarded as important in ceremonies and events.

sen.j: 平安時代には外記に職掌を奪われて衰退した。
sen.e: During the Heian period, Shurei had their duties absorbed by Geki and lost its roles.
In the Heian period, Shurei had their duties absorbed by Geki and lost its roles.
In the Heian period, Shurei had their duties absorbed by Geki and lost its roles.

Daishurei (Senior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade) Two
